general.name: apStar
general.description: apStar files contain the spectral data for a given star.  apStar files combine data from multiple visits, and combine the data from the three chips. Spectra are resampled onto a simple logarithmic wavelength scale. Both combined spectra as well as the resampled individual visit spectra are output.

surveys.name: APOGEE-2
surveys.long: Apache Point Observatory Galactic Evolution Experiment 2
surveys.description: An infrared stellar spectroscopic survey of Milky Way stars in the Northern and Southern hemispheres

surveys.name: MWM
surveys.description: A time-domain, optical+IR spectroscopic survey of Milky Way stars of all types.

releases.name: WORK
releases.description: SDSS unreleased data.  Represents any work-in-progress data.

general.naming_convention: apStar-.+-[0-9]{5}\.fits, where .+ (a.k.a. STARNAME) uniquely identifies each star and [0-9]{5} is the 5-digit MJD number of the last data included in the combined frames. There will also be a link, apStar-STARNAME.fits to the latest combined frame. apStar-STARNAME\.html

changelog.description: Describes changes to the datamodel product and/or file structure from one release to another

header.comment: Creation UTC (CCCC-MM-DD) date of FITS header

header.value: FITS (Flexible Image Transport System) format is defined in 'Astronomy

header.comment: First APOGEE targeting flag (bitwise, see docs)
Second APOGEE targeting flag (bitwise, see docs
mean heliocentric velocity (km/s) as determined from cross-correlation of resampled visit spectrum against combined spectrum and cross-correlation of combined spectrum with best matching template
mean heliocentric velocity (km/s) from SYNTHVHELIO: heliocentric velocity as determined from cross-correlation of resampled visit spectrum with best matching template to combined spectrum
median error of SYNTHVHELIO velocity (km/s) fro
bitwise OR of individual visit starflags + possible additional bits set in star combination
bitwise AND of individual visit starflags + possible additional bits set in star combination
effective temperature (K) from mini-grid cross correlation
surface gravity (dex) from mini-grid cross correlation
alpha abundance for mini-grid cross correlation
carbon abundance for mini-grid cross correlatio
FWHM of RV CCF of star with template (km/s)
FWHM of RV CCF of template with template (km/s)
surface gravity (dex) from visit mini-grid xcor
alpha abundance from visit mini-grid xcorr
carbon abundance from visit mini-grid xcorr
surface gravity (dex) from visit mini-grid xcor
alpha abundance from visit mini-grid xcorr
carbon abundance from visit mini-grid xcorr
surface gravity (dex) from visit mini-grid xcor
alpha abundance from visit mini-grid xcorr
carbon abundance from visit mini-grid xcorr

Min pixel of green chip contrib, any frame
Maxm pixel of green chip contrib, any frame

header.value: APSTAR:  APOGEE Reduction Pipeline Version: v3_09
APSTAR: The data are in separate extensions:
APSTAR:    row 1: combined spectrum with individual pixel weighting
APSTAR:    row 2: combined spectrum with global weighting
APSTAR:    row 3-nvisits+2: individual resampled visit spectra
APSTAR:   unless nvisits=1, which only have a single row
APSTAR:  All spectra shifted to rest (vacuum) wavelength scale
APSTAR:    row 1: bitwise OR of all visits
APSTAR:    row 2: bitwise AND of all visits
APSTAR:  HDU9 - RV and CCF structure

hdu1.description: Combined and individual spectra for star, at apStar sampling. Each spectrum has 8575 columns with the spectra, and 2+NVISITS rows. The first two rows are both combined spectra, with different weighting: first row uses pixel-based weighting, while second uses a more "global" weighting. If NVISITS=1, there will only be one row. Data: FITS image

hdu2.description: Uncertainty in spectrum. Rows are as in HDU1. Note that these errors are not strictly independent, because the spectra have been resampled. Data: FITS image

hdu3.description: Mask arrays corresponding to the spectra in HDU1. See APOGEE_PIXMASK definition Data: FITS image

hdu4.description: Sky spectra corresponding to HDU1. Note that these are not directly what was subtracted, as sky subtraction is done at the individual exposure level! Data: FITS image

hdu5.description: Uncertainty for HDU5 Data: FITS image

hdu6.description: Telluric spectra corresponding to HDU1. Note that these are not directly what was subtracted, as sky subtraction is done at the individual exposure level! Data: FITS image

hdu7.description: Uncertainty for HDU6 Data: FITS image

hdu8.description: Gauss-Hermite coefficients for LSF for spectra in HDU1 Data: FITS image

header.value: LSF Coefficients to be used with LSF_GH.PRO:
binsize  The width of a pixel in X-units.  If this is non-zero
then a "binned" Gauss-Hermite function is used.  If
X0       An additive x-offset.  This is only used to
evaluate the GH parameters that vary globally
Horder   The highest Hermite order, Horder=0 means
only a constant term (i.e. only Gaussian).
There are Horder Hermite coefficients (since we fix H0=1).
Porder   This array gives the polynomial order for the
global variation (in X) of each LSF parameter.
That includes sigma and the Horder Hermite
coefficients (starting with H1 because we fix H0=1)
There will be Porder[i]+1 coefficients for
GHcoefs  The polynomial coefficients for sigma and the
Horder Hermite parameters.  There are Porder[i]+1
coefficients for parameter i.  The Hermite parameters
start with H1 since we fix H0=1.

hdu9.description: Table with RV information for each visit for this star

VREL.name: VREL
VREL.description: RVs of all visits as determined by cross-correlation of reampled visit spectrum with combined spectrum, and cross-correlation of combined spectrum with best matching template

TEFF.name: TEFF
TEFF.description: Teff for template spectrum that best matches combined spectrum

LOGG.name: LOGG
LOGG.description: log g for template spectrum that best matches combined spectrum

FEH.name: FEH
FEH.description: [Fe/H] for template spectrum that best matches combined spectrum

ALPHA.name: ALPHA
ALPHA.description: [alpha/Fe] for template spectrum that best matches combined spectrum

CARBON.name: CARBON
CARBON.description: [C/Fe] for template spectrum that best matches combined spectrum

SYNTHVREL.name: SYNTHVREL
SYNTHVREL.description: RVs of all visits as determined by cross-correlation of each resampled visit spectrum with the template that best matches the combined spectrum

CCF.name: CCF
CCF.description: Cross-correlation function of combined spectra and individual visits with best-matching template from mini-grid

CCFDW.name: CCFDW
CCFDW.description: Delta (log_10 lambda): log lambda spacing per lag step (6.d-6 corresponds to 4.145 km/s)

header.value: LSF Coefficients to be used with LSF_GH.PRO:
binsize  The width of a pixel in X-units.  If this is non-zero
then a "binned" Gauss-Hermite function is used.  If
X0       An additive x-offset.  This is only used to
evaluate the GH parameters that vary globally
Horder   The highest Hermite order, Horder=0 means
only a constant term (i.e. only Gaussian).
There are Horder Hermite coefficients (since we fix H0=1).
Porder   This array gives the polynomial order for the
global variation (in X) of each LSF parameter.
That includes sigma and the Horder Hermite
coefficients (starting with H1 because we fix H0=1)
There will be Porder[i]+1 coefficients for
GHcoefs  The polynomial coefficients for sigma and the
Horder Hermite parameters.  There are Porder[i]+1
coefficients for parameter i.  The Hermite parameters
start with H1 since we fix H0=1.

hdu9.description: Table with RV information for each visit for this star

VREL.name: VREL
VREL.description: RVs of all visits as determined by cross-correlation of reampled visit spectrum with combined spectrum, and cross-correlation of combined spectrum with best matching template

TEFF.name: TEFF
TEFF.description: Teff for template spectrum that best matches combined spectrum

LOGG.name: LOGG
LOGG.description: log g for template spectrum that best matches combined spectrum

FEH.name: FEH
FEH.description: [Fe/H] for template spectrum that best matches combined spectrum

ALPHA.name: ALPHA
ALPHA.description: [alpha/Fe] for template spectrum that best matches combined spectrum

CARBON.name: CARBON
CARBON.description: [C/Fe] for template spectrum that best matches combined spectrum

SYNTHVREL.name: SYNTHVREL
SYNTHVREL.description: RVs of all visits as determined by cross-correlation of each resampled visit spectrum with the template that best matches the combined spectrum

CCF.name: CCF
CCF.description: Cross-correlation function of combined spectra and individual visits with best-matching template from mini-grid

CCFDW.name: CCFDW
CCFDW.description: Delta (log_10 lambda): log lambda spacing per lag step (6.d-6 corresponds to 4.145 km/s)
